subject: RE: [junit] Definitions question
msgSnippet: ... snip ... That would violate the Hurry up and wait doctrine . Such vacation would obviously be denied. JB, you need to spend some time working in the belly
messageBody:

>> or: "You need to bite the heads off of chickens? Oh my
>goodness, don't
>> do anything until the CIO appoints a commitee to research
>the industry
>> standard breed of chicken."
>
>PROGRAMMER: "Shall I go on vacation, then?"

That would violate the "Hurry up and wait doctrine". Such vacation would obviously be denied. JB, you need to spend some time working in the belly of the beast ... you're obviously employed by far too reasonable an employer. :-)

Simon
